name: TownePlace Suites by Marriott Charlotte Arrowood

reviews.text: Stayed here with my family for the Belk Bowl. Room was clean, well appointed and exactly as I expected. I stayed with points but I also checked prices before booking and the rate was a good value. I did make a request to switch to a larger room for the last night of our stay, but only if it wasn't any trouble. The desk staff (Melvin was the manager; sorry, I forget the young lady's name) went the extra mile to help make that happen since my reservation using points made a room switch a bit more complicated. Got everything moved and the bigger room was MUCH appreciated!! I would not hesitate to stay here again for business or leisure. We have been to a lot of Marriott properties under their various brands, and have almost always been extremely happy with everything. Towneplace Suites Arrowood definitely sets the bar higher and is a great example of taking good care of your customers. Thanks!!
reviews.title: Great staff, great property, great location - they've got it all!

reviews.text: I stayed here during the week of the Democratic Convention, when even the sleaziest motels were charging an arm and a leg. I stumbled upon a website deal for this hotel that was way too good to be true. I'm still not convinced it wasn't some sort of error because it was $100 cheaper than the cockroach motels in dicey parts of town. Needless to say, I feared it was some sort of dump. But it ended up being fantastic.
reviews.title: What a deal!

reviews.text: The room was very large with a pullout sofa and a good sized kitchen. The lobby space was cute, with computer stations, newspapers and a surprisingly solid continental breakfast (I usually skip free hotel breakfasts because they're inedible, but this was decent). Everything was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: As for location, the surrounding area is very, very sleepy, with just a Starbucks and a couple of other hotels. So if your main reason for being in Charlotte is uptown, you might want to stay somewhere else. Having said that, with this place being right off the highway I was able to drive to Uptown in 10 minutes without any problems. For convention week, that was phenomenal.
reviews.title: Town Place Suites Marriott

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for the great rate! However you get what you. pay for. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in the 2nd building. For a suite it was very small. The room keys worked some of the time but rarely. The stove didn't work, the fridge made loud noises and worst of all the walls are paper thin! Our room was right next to the stairs and all night long people were going up and down we got no sleep. There was not enough parking so you have to park wherever you can find and walk. Questionable people were hanging outside the door all night long laughing and partying. We complained to the front desk but nothing was done. These same people were in and out slamming doors all night. We could hear them yelling and partying in their room across the hall too. There dog barked all the time. There are too many things wrong with this place to even list them all! This was by far the WORST stay we have ever had! Previous reviews have said that the problems were fixed but this a lie! Stay anywhere but here!
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our yearly north from Florida we stay in the Charlotte area, and our first choice in Lake Norman was booked, so we stayed at TownePlace Suites. Away from the bustle in a residential area, the hotel was up to Marriott standards, though the kitchen cabinets showed a little wear. The Rooms were spotless, carpet looked new, comfortable beds, cloaked in white duvets with multiple pillows, good TV reception and parking options. Although we did not stay for breakfast (prefer to be on the road at 5 AM) we had a take-out meal for dinner from a nearby grocery store that featured latino cooking. We would use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, value

reviews.text: Having 2 bedrooms and a kitchen was exactly what I needed traveling with my 10 month old. The breakfast wasn't too good-the bananas were bruised everyday, and on our last night there a large, loud group was parting in the lot below our suite. The staff however was very nice the whole time and they did tell the group to quiet down ( which they didn't ) Overall it was what I was looking for at a great price!
reviews.title: Suited my needs

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days after getting back from St Kitts. My father in law made the reservation. He had requested connecting rooms but when we got in they said there were none available. My wife and I and kids stayed in room across hallway - bottom floor.
reviews.title: Horrible night sleep

reviews.text: My complaints about this room - it was very noisey - not sure if noise was from water pipes from people above us taking showers or what. I just know this would happen at all hours. Other complaints - this room can sleep up to 4. 2 in queen size bed and 2 kids in pull out sofa - so why are we only given 2 towels and washcloths. Each of the 3 days we needed to ask the front desk for more towels.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Did not try the free breakfast - my wife said she could see through the coffee. So we ate out.
reviews.title: Great Value, Good location

aka: Towneplace Suites By Marriott Charlotte Arrowood Hotel Charlotte
description: The Towneplace Suites by Marriott Charlotte Arrowood is conveniently located at I-77 and I-485, just minutes from Charlotte International Airport (CLT). This extended-stay hotel's Charlotte, NC location is just six miles from Uptown Charlotte, Charlotte Convention Center, Bank of America Stadium, and Time Warner Cable Arena. Also close by are such attractions as Carowinds, Billy Graham Library, U.S. National Whitewater Center, and the Charlotte Motor Speedway. Surrounded by numerous business parks including Forest Point, Arrowridge, Pine Brook, Red Oak, and White Oak - this long term stay Charlotte hotel's accommodations offer the ideal balance between work and life. Select from our spacious studios, or 1-and 2-bedroom suites complete with full kitchen, work space and high-speed Internet. Amongst extended-stay hotels in Charlotte, NC, Towneplace Suites' features include free Wi-Fi, complimentary breakfast, fitness center, pool, on-site laundry facilities, and an ideal place to host group events.
